title: Phrack Pro-Phile II
historical_context: This article is part of the early Phrack series, which documents the hacker and phreaker culture of the 1980s, providing insights into the lives of notable figures in the community.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and those interested in the history of hacking culture.
short_summary: This article profiles Broadway Hacker, a notable figure in the BBS and phreaking community of the 1980s, detailing his background, interests, and contributions to the hacker culture.
summary: Broadway Hacker, whose real name is Mike, began his foray into the BBS world in 1983 and quickly became a notable figure in the phreaking community. His bulletin board, The Broadway Show, launched in 1985, attracted many elite members of the hacking community, showcasing the collaborative and competitive spirit of the time. The article captures Broadway's passion for telecommunications and his experiences at various conferences, where he met other influential phreakers. Despite his deep involvement in the community, Broadway expresses a disinterest in programming beyond maintaining his BBS and a reluctance to join formal groups, preferring the freedom of his independent pursuits.
